segments.source_content:
---
slug: /212
title: "This Week In React #212: Astro, Next.js, Storybook, INP, Virtualization, WebXR, LiveView, Radon, Yoga, Unistyles, gluestack, Expo-Video, Node, Playwright, Prisma, Undici..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 12-04-2024
---
This week React developers have either been super grateful or busy spending money on useless things. Luckily, Astro is here to make the headline. We also have 2 great React perf articles.

segments.source_content: Node 22.12 is here, with `require(esm)` enabled by default in LTS! There's also a TC39 meeting in progress with ES proposals progressing, but that's for next week!

segments.source_content: A new major version of Astro just dropped. While technically not a pure React framework, itâ€™s still widely used in the React community, can easily integrate interactive React components, and relies on MDX. The headlines are:

translations.fr: Une nouvelle version majeure d'Astro vient de sortir. Bien que techniquement pas un framework React pur, il reste largement utilisÃ© dans la communautÃ© React, intÃ¨gre facilement des composants React interactifs et repose sur MDX. Les points forts sont :
translations.en: Une nouvelle version majeure d'Astro vient de sortir. Bien que techniquement ce ne soit pas un framework React pur, il est encore largement utilisÃ© dans la communautÃ© React, peut facilement intÃ©grer des composants React interactifs et repose sur MDX. Les points forts sont :

segments.source_content:
- Content Layer to bring all of your content into one friendly, type-safe data store. Including from CMS, APIs, and other sources.
- Server Islands for serving an initial page response as fast as possible, while keeping the ability to interleave dynamic content into a mostly static layout. A quite interesting and simpler alternative to React Server Components and Next.js Partial Pre-Rendering.
- Simplified prerendering, removing the â€œhybridâ€ option
- Type-safe environment variables
- Vite 6 with the new Environment API
- Experimental features: image cropping, responsive image layouts, SVG components

translations.fr:
- Content Layer pour centraliser tout votre contenu dans un magasin de donnÃ©es convivial et typÃ©. Incluant les CMS, API et autres sources.
- Server Islands pour servir une rÃ©ponse de page initiale aussi vite que possible, tout en intÃ©grant du contenu dynamique dans une mise en page majoritairement statique. Une alternative intÃ©ressante et plus simple aux React Server Components et au Partial Pre-Rendering de Next.js.
- PrÃ©-rendu simplifiÃ©, supprimant l'option "hybride".
- Variables d'environnement typÃ©es.
- Vite 6 avec la nouvelle Environment API.
- FonctionnalitÃ©s expÃ©rimentales : rognage d'images, mises en page responsives d'images, composants SVG.
translations.en:
- Content Layer pour rassembler tout votre contenu dans un magasin de donnÃ©es convivial et type-safe. Y compris depuis des CMS, des API et d'autres sources.
- Server Islands pour servir une rÃ©ponse de page initiale aussi rapidement que possible, tout en conservant la possibilitÃ© d'entrelacer du contenu dynamique dans une mise en page principalement statique. Une alternative plus simple et assez intÃ©ressante aux React Server Components et au Prerendering Partiel de Next.js.
- Prerendering simplifiÃ©, supprimant l'option Â« hybride Â»
- Variables d'environnement type-safe
- Vite 6 avec la nouvelle API Environment
- FonctionnalitÃ©s expÃ©rimentales : recadrage d'image, mises en page d'images responsives, composants SVG

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Omlet â€“ Scan your repo and measure how and where React components are used](https://omlet.dev/?utm_campaign=partner_this-week-in-react_newsletter-quick-link-nov-2024)
- ğŸ‘€ [Next.js PR \- Undeprecate revalidate APIs and rename expire APIs](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/73193): I mentioned new expire APIs to replace the revalidate APIs, but it was a bit too early apparently. The new expire APIs are now marked as unstable and will be iterated on.
- ğŸ‘€ [Next.js Canary \- `authInterrupts` APIs](https://nextjs.org/docs/canary/app/api-reference/config/next-config-js/authInterrupts): New forbidden/unauthorized functions and file conventions to return 401/403 status codes.
- ğŸ‘€ [Next.js Canary \- New config option to disable CSS chunking](https://nextjs.org/docs/canary/app/api-reference/config/next-config-js/cssChunking)
- ğŸ“œ [How To Improve INP: React](https://kurtextrem.de/posts/improve-inp-react): Interaction-to-Next-Paint is now part of Core Web Vitals, and many React sites do not have a great INP score according to the httparchive data. This article greatly explains how to optimize your appâ€™s INP score by sharing many pragmatic tips learned from experience. Covering scheduling, concurrent features, hydration, transitions, state updates, uncontrolled inputs, effects, portalsâ€¦
- ğŸ“œ [Better Code Rendering Through Virtualization](https://sentry.engineering/blog/better-code-rendering-through-virtualization): CodeCov engineer explains the process of troubleshooting a performance problem while rendering a 52k line file from the TypeScript codebase. They successfully adopted the TanStack virtualization library and documented challenges encountered (native search and scrolling).
- ğŸ“œ [Storybook Component Testing for RSCs](https://storybook.js.org/blog/component-testing-rscs/): Testing RSCs usually requires E2E tests, and Storybook proposes an alternative strategy (experimental) that runs faster, directly in the browser, after mocking server IOs.
- ğŸ“œ [Thoughts on Tailwind 4](https://nmn.sh/blog/2024-11-30-thoughts-on-tailwind-4): Itâ€™s more about CSS than React, but the creator of the Meta StyleX CSS-in-JS library expressed concerns. The introduction of descendant variants breaks the atomic CSS guarantees.
- ğŸ“œ [Introducing Efficient Valkey-Based Caching for Next.js](https://blog.platformatic.dev/introducing-efficient-valkey-based-caching-for-nextjs): Platformatic explains how they provide a scalable shared cache to their hosting platform thanks to the Next.js pluggable cache handler system.
- ğŸ“œ [React Data Fetching Patterns](https://www.robinwieruch.de/react-data-fetching-patterns/)
- ğŸ“œ [Getting more out of i18next in React](https://lingual.dev/blog/getting-more-out-of-i18next-in-react/)
- ğŸ“œ [Run your Next.js SSR app on Deno Deploy](https://deno.com/blog/nextjs-on-deno-deploy)
- ğŸ“œ [EdgePipes \- The Alternative to SSR and RSCs](https://runspired.com/2024/12/01/edge-pipes.html)
- ğŸ“œ [If Not React, Then What?](https://infrequently.org/2024/11/if-not-react-then-what/): I donâ€™t know if you want me to include React criticisms like this in the newsletter. Reading it doesnâ€™t spark me joy ğŸ˜…. Please reply and tell me\!
- ğŸ“¦ [Phoenix LiveView 1.0](https://phoenixframework.org/blog/phoenix-liveview-1.0-released): Itâ€™s an Elixir release, but I believe itâ€™s still super relevant for React developers since LiveView and RSCs are kind-of similar in their way of making the network disappear.
- ğŸ“¦ [WebXR First Steps \- Your first steps into immersive web development](https://github.com/meta-quest/webxr-first-steps-react): A 2-hour tutorial to build an immersive VR FPS mini-game using React-Three-XR.

`<Waitlist />` is a new sign-up mode and component that lets users register interest and join a waitlist for early access to your product.Â Manage user access and onboarding all within your Clerk Dashboard. Read our changelog announcement for more details.

segments.source_content: Software Mansion created a VSCode extension (also supporting Cursor) that turns your editor into a fully fledged IDE for React Native and Expo. Itâ€™s now officially launched as a stable version. Itâ€™s a paid product, but considering the low price and the DX improvement, itâ€™s a no-brainer that also supports the company's great open source efforts. Take a look at the [Radon IDE launch video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=07Un9EfE8D4) to have a quick overview of the features: simulators panel and settings, debugging, click-to-inspect, URL-driven navigation, storybook integration, and more.

C'est un produit payant, mais compte tenu du prix abordable et de l'amÃ©lioration de la DX, c'est une Ã©vidence qui soutient Ã©galement les formidables efforts open source de l'entreprise. Consultez la [vidÃ©o de lancement de Radon IDE](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=07Un9EfE8D4) pour un aperÃ§u rapide des fonctionnalitÃ©s : panneau des simulateurs et paramÃ¨tres, dÃ©bogage, inspection par clic, navigation pilotÃ©e par URL, intÃ©gration de Storybook, et plus encore.
